title: Davidvictorson
author: Davidvictorson
content: Lottery – a game with established rules where players buy tickets for a chance to win cash or other merchandise prizes.Gambling – a game or mutual bet according to established rules whose participants, seeking monetary gain, voluntarily risk losing an amount they have paid in, and where winning or losing is determined by chance, by some event, or by the result of a sport competition.Sports betting - Sports betting is the activity of predicting sports results and placing a wager on the outcome.DifferencesIn a lottery, players compete against other players. A lottery’s prize fund is set in advance and the lottery operator does not participate in the game.In gambling, players compete individually against the gambling operator. It is in the gambling operator’s interest to win against the players.In Sports betting - In sports betting players places wagers on sports that include but not limited to football, basketball, baseball, hockey, track cycling, auto racing, mixed martial arts, and boxing at both the amateur and professional levels. We have an active gambling discussion section and I would very much love to hear the opinions of experienced gamblers on which has better odds, lottery, online gambling, or sports betting?Note: The idea for this post came from reading this article on Quora

comments.author: theskillzdatklls
comments.body: Sportsbetting is the best, if you are good. Pretty bad if you're bad.Regular gambling would be next but varies hugely on which game you play. Best to play low house edge provably fair games.Lottery is by far the worst, unless there's a huge jackpot, which very seldom ever happen, if ever.

It is in the gambling operator’s interest to win against the players.In Sports betting - In sports betting players places wagers on sports that include but not limited to football, basketball, baseball, hockey, track cycling, auto racing, mixed martial arts, and boxing at both the amateur and professional levels. We have an active gambling discussion section and I would very much love to hear the opinions of experienced gamblers on which has better odds, lottery, online gambling, or sports betting?Note: The idea for this post came from reading this article on Quora I believe that in terms of how probable you are of winning, the best odds are on sports betting. Especially if it's just between two teams pitting for a win. Normally the only factors that would really affect your win is how good the teams are, which could easily be discerned with a couple google searches. Lotteries have a reputation of being very hard to win, mathematicians around the world have stated that it's more probable for you to be struck by lightning multiple times than actually be a lottery winner. As for the others you have stated, like gambling, there's more to it than just odds. Innate skills, house edge, and knowledge of the game you are playing are good definers of how probable one is of winning.

comments.author: KTChampions
comments.body: In the lottery, the advantage of the lottery operator over the player is more than 50%, which is obviously the worst option for gambling. In betting, the bookmaker's advantage is from 4 to 8 percent. In gambling, from 1 to 5 percent. The most expedient game is dice - 1% house edge.But betting has its advantages - a variety of promotions that significantly increase your odds, plus sometimes you can find a bet with favorable odds, that is, literally one where you have an advantage over the bookmaker. There is nothing like it in the lottery or gambling.

comments.author: knowngunman
comments.body: In my own opinion, sport betting odds are more favorable to gamblers compared to the other gambling listed above. The winning probability are very high when are familiar with teams in action and its very easy to learn and understand. Although sport betting has its own forms of manipulation like match fixing and some others but it's reliability is more certain than the other two.

Just go for the one you like and have fun with the amount of money you can afford to lose.

It is in the gambling operator’s interest to win against the players.In Sports betting - In sports betting players places wagers on sports that include but not limited to football, basketball, baseball, hockey, track cycling, auto racing, mixed martial arts, and boxing at both the amateur and professional levels. We have an active gambling discussion section and I would very much love to hear the opinions of experienced gamblers on which has better odds, lottery, online gambling, or sports betting?This is an idea? Seems like a rather inane, poorly worded and obvious question really. Sports betting is a form of gambling not a separate category by itself. You probably meant casino games which tend to have pre-defined odds or if it's something like live roulette it has a natural tilt towards the house. Sports betting comes in all forms - from the barely profitable x1.01 odds to infinitely high risk and chance of winning, that could really rival the payout of some lotteries. Casino games will tend to have natural ceilings related to max bet size and the casino is much more likely to take a profit over time. Lotteries are tiny chances of winning but usually counter weighed by high payout amounts.

You also get predictions from other people who know the sport well and can help you decide. Sports betting not only gives you the highest chances of winning but is easy.Lottery is the worst because in dice you can have 49% chance to win so it's almost half but to win a lottery you usually have less than 1%.

comments.body: Selection will always depends on people favorite games to bet. comments.body: Because I am a sports lover, I think Sports betting is the best among them.Although there is no certainty regarding the percentage to win, sports betting seems a bit easier as long as we know the sports field well.Especially for people who have favorite sports, betting on sports will be a fun activity. comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Lottery is basically the simplest form of gambling. You can easily calculate the probabilities of winning since the rules are very clear and the process of selecting the numbers is random.Online gambling is basically the same as offline casinos. This means that every game will have different odds. Again, the rules are clear, but there are many, many different types of games with different rules, so calculating the odds might be a bit more difficult. The process of each game is still random though, but done in many different ways.Sports betting is similar to online gambling in the sense that there are many different games and each one has different odds. The main difference here is that, although the output of the matches are considered random, some people might have extra information about what's going on in the teams, which makes the process not completely random for some people.For example, let's say there's a match between two teams, but you went out partying the previous night with all the players of one team and they were all drinking alcohol all night.... you have information that might affect the results of the game that the general public might not know, therefore you might be in a better position there.
